title: Forum promotes awareness of dementia (with photos)
content_text:
p>
    The Food and Health Bureau today (March 8) hosted a forum on the Care and 
    Support for Dementia Patients to promote awareness of dementia and encourage 
    care and support for patients and carers in the community. The forum brought together more than 200 medical professionals, service 
    providers from the welfare sector and government representatives to exchange 
    their experience, expertise and insight in the latest trend of dementia and 
    support services to patients. Mrs May Wan Kao, wife of Nobel Laureate in

support services to patients. Mrs May Wan Kao, wife of Nobel Laureate in 
    Physics Professor Charles K Kao, also shared her experience as a carer 
    providing support to a dementia patient. Addressing the forum, the Secretary for Food and Health, Dr York Chow, said 
    the Government was committed to maintaining the quality of life of dementia 
    patients. "We are providing various forms of medical treatments and support services 
    to these patients through the Hospital Authority, the Department of Health,

to these patients through the Hospital Authority, the Department of Health, 
    the Social Welfare Department and the non-government organisations.  "To meet the changing needs, we have launched a series of measures to 
    strengthen the support services to dementia patients in the past few years," 
    Dr Chow said. "These include the expansion of psychogeriatric outreach 
    services, improvement of associated facilities in elderly homes and elderly 
    health care centres, as well as stepping up public education and promotion

health care centres, as well as stepping up public education and promotion 
    of the concept of caring for the elderly." Dr Chow pointed out that family members and carers played an important role 
    in the nursing of dementia patients. Besides providing physical assistance, 
    they also offered spiritual support and encouragement to the patients. "We fully understand the stress the carers are facing in their everyday 
    lives. We are providing support to them through various channels, hoping

lives. We are providing support to them through various channels, hoping 
    that a closer partnering relationship could be established," he said.  Dr Chow also took the opportunity to express his gratitude to Professor and 
    Mrs Kao for their concern for dementia patients in Hong Kong; their earnest 
    practice in calling for the community's awareness of the disease; as well as 
    their generous support to the services for the patients and the carers.  During today's forum, participants exchanged views on various topics about 
    dementia, including research findings on the global trend of dementia;

dementia, including research findings on the global trend of dementia; diagnosis and symptomatology of the disease; treatment to patients by the Hospital Authority, services provided by the Department of Health on training and education for carers of dementia patients; the role of carers in providing support to dementia patients; and the development of day care and residential care services for dementia patients. Ends/Monday, March 8, 2010
Issued at HKT 19:30
